<NEW =96 WHEELI=

Wheelie shook his head, "There is something out there, something wrong.=
  Something we do not know is going on.  This is bigger going about, I fear=
 what we may find out.  We shall have to take care, as we go into the jungl=
e and seek out there."

Nodding at LEO, "Then we will have to get up and ou=
t we go.  We cannot leave Rodimus alone, who knows when we shall find his h=
ome."

aring of his throat, to get the attention of everyone in the room.

 It isn't worth risking your lives just to try and do something on your own=

on't take on more than you can handle.  Now, let's meet with everyone and s=

<NEW =96 WHEELIE=
>

Wheelie glanced timidly over at Straight Shot and Rattrap.  He didn't li=
ke them one bit, and he felt that given RODIMUS was missing that now was no=
t the time for the `learn the meaning of friendship', as someone in the pas=
t he knew would have put it so belligerently.  But he knew that they could =
nto put their issues aside until later, and he would have to deal with it n=
ow to the best of his abilities, and now was not the time for being offensi=
ve.

For now, like it or not (probably not) the little orange racer was in =
the army, and htat meang going along with orders.  Nodding up at TUSCON, "T=
hen we should go and out, and find thigns before they get worse about.  Rod=
imus is powerful yes, and we might lose him if we waste time abreast."

Nod=
ding at Straight Shot and Rattrap, "Then we had better go, we have to get o=
ut fast before we lose what we know.  We have to start searching about, bef=
ore we lose what we're sent to find out!"

ndlord arrived at the place and said at Tucson"Sir, Talon has arrived at th=

<OL=
D =96 TUSCON>

> Tucson looks to Windlord with a sigh of relief.  He was ha=
ppy to have Talon back safe at the Ark.  He then takes a moment to collect =
his thoughts.

> " Let Talon know that she is more than welcome to join u=
s here in the ready room.  And as far as what to expect, I'm not sure but w=
e should keep a bodyguard with Nightlight and Elita.  They must not leave t=
he Ark until I deem it safe to do so. " 
> 
> He leans up against the wall,=
 watching the computer models carefully.
> 
> " There is no easy way around=
 this situation, we're all in for a tough road ahead.  Now, I am not going =
to force anyone into anything, I will allow everyone to make a choice that =
best suits them and the mission at hand.  And whatever they wish to do is a=
lright with me."
> 
> Something nudged at his logic system what would make =
someone vanish off the ends of the Earth without a trace?  Then the answer =
his him and it hits hard.  
> 
> " Space bridge....."
> 
> He turns his hea=
d sharply to Leo Prime.
> 
> "Leo, I think I know what could have happened =
to Optimus Primal.
> Only a space bridge would be capable of causing a stra=
nge disappearances as what happened to Primal.  Perhaps a bridge with a tim=
e rift component. I wonder... Scan for rift activity, I don't know for sure=
 but that's what it looks like."

<NEW =96 WHEELIE>

Now this had Wheelie l=
ooking up, whether shocked, against, or something different, "NO, you don't=
 get it.  A Space Bridge is not small, it is not hidden.  It is huge and it=
 will do as bidden.  It would not make someone go bye bye without a cry, it=
 would be as if half the planet had bene here to die.  Believe me, if there=
 was one up, we would know right away.  From a column of light into space t=
hat would be visible far far away.  It cannot be hidden, it is so enormous =
it would do what it is bidden."

Glancing up at Tuscon, "There are plenty o=
f things that canmadke someone go invisible and hdie.  That is far from the=
 top of the list, and far thigns wide.  One cannot hide a portal in space, =
even from scanners, optics know their place.  We would see it, we would tel=
l, we would tell the shunt shooting up to Primus knows well.  So that it is=
 not, that it is ridiculous, utterly and absolutely totally it gives me fit=
s.  Far easier to do something like a cloak, a sensor jammer, someone steal=
th whom can poke.  They could have simply blasted him offline, and carried =
him off in Beast mode this time.  So, what you suggest is the least likely =
thing, likely to bring Unicron himself over to wing.  So think first before=
 you run an idea, and file it away in ridiculous or so I hear!"  

Wheelie =
had been trying to be respectful and listen to orders, but at the point Tus=
con had come up with something the small Mini Vehicle thought was utterly a=
bsurd, totally nonsense and the most remote thing that could have happened =
that if did they would instantly know to him was just wasting time.  His th=
oughts were that Tuscon wanted them to not find Rodimus, his friend, by was=
ting their time on such trivialities!  Standing up and ready to storm, "If =
you want to waste your time, then you won't waste mine.  Withuot you then I=
 will go, in search of my friend and out I know.  This is stupid, this is a=
bsurd, your vocalizer just wants to be heard."

Ready to storm out towards =
the jungle, with or without orders, with or without Straight Shot and Rattr=
ap.  This was Wheelie being belligerent and baiting, whether he was given o=
rders or not.

OOC =96 Yes, he is definitely acting out here if you want ot=
